name: InfectedDeviceEmailTemplate
content:
Hi,

We have identified that a [ ] device being used by you (Mac address [ ]) is making call outs to a known malicious IP address, this may be an indicator that your device is infected with malware. I would recommend downloading antivirus software and cleaning your device. 

King's College London provides an antivirus software which can be downloaded by clicking on the following link: https://kclupdates.kcl.ac.uk/AV/default.aspx 

Any problems or queries please call me on the number below.
 
To help us deliver an efficient service, please respond to this email within 5 working days.  If you cannot provide the necessary information in this time it is important you tell us, otherwise we will close your ticket.

Kind regards,

";

name: AccountQueryStaff
content:
Dear Colleague,

Thanks for your email.

In response to your enquiry, your KCL Account remains active until you have either left your employment with King's or your Staff contract expires.

When the Account de-provisioning process starts, you are given a total of 60 days before it is removed from the systems. For the first 30 days, the Account will be marked for deletion and for the remaining 30 days, it will be disabled. During this period, you can request to convert your Staff Account into an Affiliate Account by completing the King's Affiliate Account Request form on the Self-Service Portal (8888.kcl.ac.uk) Ã¢â‚¬â€œ this would mean that your access, email address, emails and files will all remain intact. However, all requests for Affiliate Accounts need to be approved by an Authorised Signatory as it assumes you are still working at King's in a honorary capacity, or performing a significant teaching, research or administrative role. We cannot convert an account without this approval.

If you would like to proceed with the conversion, please complete the form on the Self-Service Portal, found under the Common Service Requests section. If you find you are unable to login to this site as your Account is already in the disabled state, please ask a colleague to submit the request on your behalf, or contact the Service Desk where an Analyst will be happy to assist.

**Please note that, even if the Affiliate Account Request is approved we cannot actually start the conversion process until your account enters the 'Marked for Deletion' stage and you receive the generic notification to advise your Account is due to expire. This is when your Staff Account becomes de-activated in the HRMS system**

Please let me know if you are happy with the above information and I will close this ticket.

Many thanks


Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.
If you are dissatisfied with the advice or service provided please email ML-Super-DL@kcl.ac.uk to escalate to a member of the Service Desk Management Team.";

name: AccountQueryStudent
content:
Dear Student,

Thanks for your email.

In response to your enquiry, your KCL Account remains active until after you have officially graduated/finished your course.

When the Account de-provisioning process starts, you are given a total of 60 days before it is removed from the systems. For the first 30 days, the Account will be marked for deletion and for the remaining 30 days, it will be disabled. During this period, you can request to convert your Student Account into an Affiliate Account by completing the King's Affiliate Account Request form on the Self-Service Portal (8888.kcl.ac.uk) Ã¢â‚¬â€œ this would mean that your access, email address, emails and files will all remain intact. However, all requests for Affiliate Accounts need to be approved by an Authorised Signatory as it assumes you are still working at King's in a honorary capacity, or performing a significant teaching, research or administrative role. We cannot convert an account without this approval.

If you would like to proceed with the conversion, please complete the form on the Self-Service Portal, found under the Common Service Requests section. If you find you are unable to login to this site as your Account is already in the disabled state, please ask a colleague to submit the request on your behalf, or contact the Service Desk where an Analyst will be happy to assist.

**Please note that, even if the Affiliate Account Request is approved we cannot actually start the conversion process until your account enters the Marked for Deletion stage and you receive the generic notification to advise your Account is due to expire.**

Please let me know if you are happy with the above information and I will close this ticket.

Many thanks

Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.
If you are dissatisfied with the advice or service provided please email ML-Super-DL@kcl.ac.uk to escalate to a member of the Service Desk Management Team.";

name: AdobeConnectRequest
content:
Thank you for contacting the Service desk

New Adobe Connect Accounts are paid for by individual faculties on a pro rata basis. Payment is pro rata as all King's Adobe Connect licences are renewed annually in August. 
A new account will need to be arranged and paid for before access to Adobe Connect is granted. 

Please send Pauline (pauline.foley@collab8.com) who is the Adobe Connect Account's manager, the following email in order for the new account to be created. 
Pauline will provide a pro rata quote for the licence, to enable you to arrange for a purchase order/payment.
Once an account has been purchased and created, please respond to this email (quoting ticket reference xxxxxxx) so the request can be actioned internally. 

Dear Pauline

Re: Request for Adobe Connect Licence for King's College London

Please provide a pro rata quote for new Adobe Connect Licence for King's College London.
Request type: creation of new Adobe Connect named host annual account
Full name of new licensee: 
King's email:
What faculty they belong to: 
IT ticket number (remedy force ticket):
The licence will need to be added to the kingscollege.adobeconnect.com account. 

Kind regards,";

name: AutoResponseQAResourceRequest
content:
Thank you for raising a request for QA resource for your upcoming project/change.

Please note we are dealing with a large number of engagements meaning we are having to carefully prioritise the work coming into the team and it may take longer than usual to respond to your enquiry.

As per the QA process we will contact you to set up a meeting to discuss:

  *   Overview of the project and timescales
  *   Discuss the requirements for this project
  *   Discuss the assignment of QA resources to the project

Thank you for your patience.  We will be in touch.

Kind regards

Jessica
Head of Transition and QA


Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.

";

name: BWSADOWorkItem
content:
Thank you for your request. 

The work will require further consideration and will be managed through our system development program Microsoft Azure DevOps (ADO). 
If you could please complete and return the required fields underlined below. The work will then be allocated an ADO reference, queued for development and assigned to a member of the Business World system admin team to progress. 

Requirement
Please provide as much detail as possible for your request including specifications and screenshots. 

Business Benefit/Justification
Please use this section to support/justify the work. E.g. What improvements can be realised from carrying out the task - control? time saving? What strategic objectives does this help meet? How many people would this affect? 

A MoSCoW Priority
Please indicate how important you view the work to be by deleting the below categories as applicable 

Must Have
Must Have requirements are critical to the running of the finance system, an individual module or function is not viable without this work. 
The work would be considered a 'showstopper' during an upgrade project as the system is unusable for its intended purpose or may be a compliance/control requirement related to financial accuracy, security and privacy, or a legal obligation. 

Should Have
Should Have requirements are important but not vital. 
They are either causing serious issues, but the system is still viable. There may be workaround in place or the ability to develop one, even if only temporarily. Alternatively, it is believed this work will bring significant business value and process improvements if implemented. 

Could Have
Could Have requirements are desirable but less important. 
They are nice to have but will have less impact than a Should Have work item. They are developed and deployed in an ideal scenario or are maybe a longer-term goal. 

Would Have
These requirements are the least critical and won't be completed at this point in time. 
This category is to be used to allow greater focus on the more important categories above, it is a useful record of an idea or task but is currently outside the scope of any strategy or system development. A Would Have category can be converted into a Could Have later.  

Kind regards,

Business World Support (Finance System Administration)
nKing's College London";

name: BYODWaiver
content:
Hi there

Thank you for contacting us about the issue with your Personal Device.

In order for us to proceed, we require the following BYOD Waiver to be agreed to.
Please ensure you have read and understood the information fully before responding.

1. General - By agreeing to this waiver you authorise us to carry out the services as requested by you. We shall use all reasonable endeavours to provide good quality support, but specific results cannot be guaranteed. You understand and agree that there may be circumstances under which we are unable to support you. This may be due to various factors, for example, if your computer is too old.
2. Completion Time - Support is provided on a first-come-first-served basis during normal opening hours. You must remain present while support is carried out.
3. Back up of data - It is your responsibility to ensure that you back up your data before handing the computer to us. We will not be responsible for loss of or damage to any data nor will we be responsible for restoring lost data.
4. Impact of Upgrades - By agreeing to this waiver you confirm that you fully understand the potential impact that upgrades may have on the operating system, applications and utility software. You are aware and accept the risk that upgrades may lead to incompatibilities and possible loss of data. Computer software and hardware work together and incompatibility may not be apparent until later. It is your responsibility to contact the manufacturer of your software regarding compatibility issues before you request any upgrades.
5. Liability - You agree, understand and accept that King's College London shall have no liability for the outcome of support provided.
6. Hardware Issues Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Hardware repairs are notoriously difficult and we may therefore need to refer to a third party, which may incur charges.

To agree to this waiver, please reply to this email with the words I agree and someone will be in touch to advise as to the next steps.

If you do not agree, please reply to this email with the words I do not agree, and we will close your ticket.

With best wishes

End User Services
King's College London

Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.
";

name: CyberSecurityStreamingEmailTemplate
content:
I am writing to you because the IT Services Cyber Security function have noticed Bit Torrent activity on your account. 
Whilst using Bit Torrent is not illegal, what you use it for can be. Please read the enclosed information for more details.

If you have a work related or business case reason to use Bit Torrent, please let us know, explaining your reasons, so that we can consider whitelisting your device.
If we do not hear from you and we continue to notice Bit Torrent activity on your account then further steps may be taken, including disabling your account, so that the King's College London reputation and network are not brought into disrepute.

Here is some information you should know about illegal streaming services:

IT Services Cyber Security have recently noticed a large increase in the volume of complaints from copyright holders and agents. The majority of complaints relate to files being shared which are films and television programmes.  This may be due to copyright holders and agents becoming more efficient at locating this illegal activity or that there has been a large increase in people abusing the King's College London network. 
Did you know Streaming pirated films, TV programmes and sport is a crime
1 in 4 people who stream illegally* have been affected by viruses and malware
1 in 10 people who stream illegally* have been a victim of fraud 1 in 20 people who stream illegally* have had their personal details stolen
*those who stream through a modified box, stick or add-on and app.
By downloading with some software, you can also be sharing files.  A prime example is software using Bit Torrent technology, which shares (or uploads) parts of files whilst you are still downloading them.  You do not have to share the whole file to be in breach of copyright. 
Often file-sharing applications set themselves up to run in the background when a user turns their computer on.  If you have used such applications in the past on your own computer, make sure that they are removed or disabled before you bring your computer onto the King's College London network.  
With modern streaming services, there are numerous cost-effective ways of accessing a very wide range of content within the law and within King's College London's IT Acceptable Use policy. 
King's College London does not condone the use of illegal streaming services or the illegal sharing of files within or outside of the university network.

Kind regards,

IT Services Cyber Security";

name: DelayedTelephonyResponse
content:

If you are experiencing a business critical issue and would like to escalate, please reply to this email indicating as such as we will endeavour to respond to you as soon as possible.

We'd like to thank you for your patience and apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.";

name: ForceShutdown
content:
Thank you for the email.

In the first instance, please see the below steps to resolve this issue on your KCL SOE device.

Please ensure that all work is saved prior to carrying out the following steps:

Search for Command Prompt in the bottom left search bar of the device, and open this program.

Once this has opened, please enter: shutdown /s /t 0, and hit enter.

This will then force shutdown your device. Once you have powered this back on, this should resolve the issues on your PC.

If you do have any further issues after these steps, please let us know, and we will be happy to assist you further. 

Kind Regards

IT Service Desk
";

name: MFADeactivationRequest
content:
Thank you for contacting the IT Service Desk 

We are sorry to hear that you do not wish to have MFA enabled on your account.  Unfortunately, this is something that is being enabled on every KCL account, and there is no option to opt out. This is because MFA is essential for maintaining the security of your account and your data. 

The MFA settings have been set to provide the minimum possible disruption to your work, and you will not notice any difference at all if you are working on a King's  SOE (Standard Operating Environment) machine whilst on the King's network. 

If however, you do find that MFA is causing problems for you, please contact us and we will work with you to find a resolution. 

";

name: LoginCredentialsUseKNumber
content:
Hello,

Thank you for your email.

When logging into the page/application please can you ensure you are using the following credentials:

K Number without the @kcl.ac.uk, and IT password.

If you are unsure of your password and feel it needs resetting then please go to https://passwordreset.kcl.ac.uk - the Username is your knumber@kcl.ac.uk

The requirements for your password are a minimum of 12 characters and it must contain 3 of the following:
Lower case letter
Upper case letter
Number

You must also not use your name or common words in your password. It also cannot be the same as your previous password. If you do not know your Knumber then please reply to this email with a photo of some ID and we can send this to you.

If you are confident that you are using the correct credentials but are still having trouble using this system, please reply to this email with a screenshot attached of the issue you are having and we will do our best to assist. ";

name: NewDTC
content:
Hello,

You have now been set up as a Departmental Telecom Coordinator and are now authorised to order and manage your Department's mobile phones directly with Vodafone.
 
You can call them for queries direct on 033 33 0433 33 quoting the King's Account number (602957546) and the DTC password of London. Please note this password is for DTC's only and should not be issued to everyday users. If they have issues and need to contact Vodafone, then the password they need to supply is sunflower.

You should have received your log in details for the Vodafone Corporate Online portal (www.vcol.co.uk) which will allow you view itemised bills for your department. If not, then please expect them to be issued shortly by Vodafone.

We have an Intranet page, mentioned below that is dedicated to Mobile Device queries and on here you will find the latest DTC User Guide. Please ensure that you read this guide - it is the go-to document for all Vodafone queries and provides information on the ordering process, provides many useful hints, tips and much more.

In addition to the guide, you will find other information such as the VCOL user guide, tariff information, mobile price lists, and the Vodafone order template on our Intranet page.

Please visit https://internal.kcl.ac.uk/it/Mobile-Devices.aspx for more information.

If you have any issues or queries with which Vodafone cannot assist, please contact us on 0207 848 8888 or via 8888@kcl.ac.uk and we will be happy to help.

Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.
If you are dissatisfied with the advice or service provided please email ML-Super-DL@kcl.ac.uk to escalate to a member of the Service Desk Management Team.
";

name: OwnedAccountConversionQuery
content:
Thank you for your recent request to take over Ownership of an Owned Account.

Before we progress with the request, I am emailing to advise that we will be converting the Owned Account into a Shared Mailbox. We are working towards converting all Owned Accounts into Shared Mailboxes as they provide all the functionality that you are used to, but are much easier to manage.

Some benefits of using a Shared Mailbox are outlined below:
Ability to have more than one Owner
Full mailbox (including Calendar) access can be granted with one click instead of having to apply permissions on each folder individually
Granting permissions is user-friendly and all in control of the Owners
No additional username and password to remember
Restrictions can be set on who can email the mailbox

Once we have completed the conversion, we will amend the Ownership as requested and email over the instructions on how to manage and maintain the Shared Mailbox.

We will be in touch again shortly.

Kind regards
";

name: PhishingEmailHasUserClickedonEmail
content:
Hello,

Thank you for reporting this issue to us. 

We can confirm that the email you have received is a phishing scam, designed to look as if it comes from a legitimate source, such as a KCL account or bank. The aim is to trick you into revealing personal information such as your password, or to infect your device with malware. 

For more information about phishing, please see the following intranet page: 
https://internal.kcl.ac.uk/it/security/Advice-and-Support/phishing.aspx\n
Please reply to this email as soon as possible to confirm whether or not you have clicked on the link within the suspicious email.

If you are worried about your account security, please call the IT Service Desk on 020 784 88888 as soon as possible.";

name: PhishingEmailUserHASClickedonLink
content:
Hello,

Thank you for your email. 

Due to clicking on the link in question, it has been necessary to force reset your KCL password. Please be assured that, having done this, your account is now secure.

In order to reinstate access to your KCL Account, we will require a proof of ID (for example, Driving License, Passport, KCL ID Card) to be sent via email to 88888@kcl.ac.uk 

Once this has been received, we will reset your password and send confirmation of your temporary password, along with instructions on how to update your password, via email.

In addition to the above, please ensure your Multi Factor Authentication (MFA) is up to date via https://mfasetup.kcl.ac.uk 

For more information about phishing, please see the following Intranet page: https://internal.kcl.ac.uk/it/security/Advice-and-Support/phishing.aspx 

If you are worried about your account security, please call the IT Service Desk on 020 784 88888 as soon as possible.
";

";

name: PhishingandJunkMailReporttoMicrosoft
content:
Thank you for reporting this email to the IT Service Desk. 
Our email security filter has a self-service option for managing Spam and Phishing email messages, and reporting them direct to Microsoft. This feature is available in both Outlook and OWA (Outlook Web Access).

Outlook
You will see a Report Message button within the Ribbon in Outlook. When the required email is highlighted, use this to choose the type of Report you wish to submit about the email.

OWA
With the email in question highlighted, click on More Actions and then choose the Report Message option.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ If you believe you have received a Phishing email from a Member of KCL, please contact the IT Service Desk who will provide you with further help and guidance.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ If you would like assistance with any of the above steps or you are concerned that the phishing email you have received is particularly convincing and warrants further investigation, please reply to this email or call the IT Service Desk and a member of the team will be happy to provide you with further assistance.

What is Junk email?
Junk email messages are typically referred to as spam. These are messages that you don't want to receive that may be advertising products you don't use or find offensive. If you choose the Junk option, a copy of the message may be sent to Microsoft to help update their spam filters, and the message will be moved from your Inbox to your Junk Email folder. 

What is phishing?
Phishing is the practice of luring you into disclosing personal information, such as bank account numbers and passwords. Often phishing messages look legitimate, but have deceptive links that actually open fake websites. If you select Phishing, a copy of your message may be sent to Microsoft to help update their filters, and the message will be moved from your Inbox to your Junk Email folder. 

What is a legitimate email?
If you know the sender and you're expecting the message, or if you receive a message that's mistakenly marked as junk, you can use the Report Message add-in to mark the message as Not Junk. This will move the message from the Junk Email folder back to your Inbox. 

Further information from Microsoft can be found here: https://support.office.com/en-gb/article/use-the-report-message-add-in-b5caa9f1-cdf3-4443-af8c-ff724ea719d2

";

name: ResiCancellationEmail
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences and we are sorry to hear that you wish to cancel.

Depending on where you are in the bookings process, cancellation terms will vary:    1) If you have booked a room and cancel within the 14 days cooling off period, cancellation is free of charge and can be done in your portal using the cancel button 

 If you have booked a room and cancel before the cancellation deadline of 31st May (2020), cancellation is free of charge and can be done in the portal using the cancel button

3) If you have booked a room and want to cancel after the 31st May deadline and outside of the 14 days cooling off period, cancellation is Ã‚Â£500. You can cancel in your portal using the cancel button.

4) If you have booked a room and want to cancel after the 31st May deadline, you have passed your 14 days cooling off period and the contract start date has gone (but you have not moved in) cancellation is charged at Ã‚Â£500 plus 4 weeks rent. You can cancel in your portal using the cancel button.

5) If you are wanting to cancel after moving in, you can no longer pay to cancel and must find another full time KCL student, not already in a contract, to transfer the contract to. Please see our website for more information: https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/living-with-us/contract-change 

6) If you are withdrawing or deferring (regardless of whether you have moved in or not) the contract will be voided at no cost to you

Please ensure you follow the necessary process above to complete your cancellation.


We hope this helps you.

Kind regards,

The Residences Team



Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.

";

name: ResiForwardedtoanotherteam
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

Your email below has been received and forwarded to the relevant team for processing. They will be in contact with you directly as soon as possible, please allow 5 working days for a response whilst they look into this for you.

Should you have any other residences related questions, please do not hesitate to contact us by email on kingsresidences@kcl.ac.uk or by phone on 0207 848 5959.

Kind regards,

The Residences Team



Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.

";

name: ResiLeavingKingsResidences
content:
Thank you for getting in touch with us.

We appreciate your patience during this very unique situation and hope that you are well and staying safe.  We understand that many students are returning home to be with their families and we are doing our utmost to support you at this time. If you would like to cancel your contract (if you have not already done so), please can you reply to this email answering the following: 
 

Your full name:

Student ID:

Your residence:

Your room number: 

Have you moved out already? If yes, what date did you move out? Have you cleared your room? If you have not yet departed, what date are you planning to move out?: Will you be back again this academic year? If yes, what date are you planning on returning:

Your contract can only be cancelled on a saturday. If for example you depart on Wednesday 27th May, you will be charged until Saturday 30th May. Once you have provided this information, please wait for confirmation from the allocations team before contacting us again on this matter.

Please can you also attach proof of your departure date to your email, this can be a flight, bus or train ticket or anything else you may have to support your cancellation. If you are informing us that you left back in March, April or May but cannot provide evidence of this, a final decision will be made by the Allocation Team regarding the date your cancellation will be effective from.

If you have already departed your residence and were unable to remove all your belongings, please https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/living-with-us/moving-out regarding collection. You will also have been emailed with further instruction.

We can confirm that you will not be charged for the remainder of your contract after the specified end date, even if there are belongings in your room as long as you have provided us with the details above. Please see https://www.endsleigh.co.uk/faqs/question/coronavirus-update-block-possessions-insurance regarding your belongings and contents.

If you have not yet departed, please do plan carefully and clear your room when you leave. This will help prevent any issues in the future regarding collection of items left behind. 

We look forward to hearing from you.

Kind regards,

The Residences Team



Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.

";

name: ResiPleaseProvideDetails
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

In order for us to assist you, please can you provide your student number and full name so that we can find your details.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Kind regards,

The Residences Team



Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.

";

name: ResiRoomSwaps
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

We hope you're enjoying your time in Residences so far but we know that circumstances can change. As you know, you're bound by the contract you signed, but if you would like to swap your room with another student please see further information on this below.

If you have already found a student to swap with who is also living here with us at King's we will require the following details from you:

Your full name

KCL ID

Proof of payment for your first rent instalment
Confirmation that you have read this https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/assets/policies/room-swap-process-2021-22.pdf 

We will also need the following details of whom you wish to swap with:

Their full name

KCL ID

We can only complete swaps with like for like contracts. For example if you are an undergraduate student you would need to find another undergraduate student to swap with. If you are on KAAS you would only be able to swap with another KAAS student etc.

You can find all information on room swaps including eligibility criteria online https://www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation/living-with-us/contract-change 

Please note a non-negotiable cleaning/administration fee of  Â£50.00 will be billed to both parties via the student record portal.

Please also ensure to allow 3 weeks for us to process your room swap request.  

Unfortunately we are not able to offer room swaps or transfers for UoL properties as we do not hold the contracts for these locations. This policy is only applicable to students currently living in King's Residences, therefore does not form part of the allocation and offer process.

If you are yet to find a swap partner there are many ways for you to find student who wish to swap their room. Our Residences Facebook groups are the easiest way to connect with other residents. The Find a Flatmate Facebook managed by Advice and Guidance group hosts King's students looking for halls contracts which they would like to take over. Also, The Student Room has a large following from KCL.

More information can be found https://www.kcl.ac.uk/campuslife/services/student-advice-support/how/housing/searching/kcl-flatmate-finder-form 

We look forward to hearing from you

Kind regards,

The Residences Team



Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.

";

name: ResiShortlist
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences and we appreciate your patience whilst this was investigated. Due to unprecedented demand for undergraduate accommodation, there are not currently any available rooms at our most popular residences. We are sorry that you have not yet been able to book a room as planned. We have now opened a shortlist for those guaranteed accommodation. We will do our utmost to book a room within preference, however, due to the high volume of demand it may not be in the preferred location, but a room will still be booked and made available for you. Eligibility for the shortlist is as follows: You are an undergraduate student taking either a 40 or 48 week contract, or a study abroad student coming for the first semester or full year You do not already have a room booked for the 2020/21 academic year You have not booked a room for the 2020/21 academic year and cancelled it You registered in time to qualify for the housing guarantee (registered on or before 17th May) You did not have access to the booking page on the portal before 14th May 2020 You have actively been trying to book a room in the portal but have been unsuccessful (prior to receiving this email) We have identified you as eligible for this shortlist and we can add you to a shortlist for either:
Great Dover Street ensuite room Angel Lane ensuite room Please confirm which residence you would like to be shortlisted for. We appreciate your ongoing patience and If you have any questions please do not hesitate to ask and we look forward to hearing from you. Kind regards, The Residences Team Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.
";

name: ResiWelfareParents
content:
Thank you for contacting King's Residences.

We appreciate that you are very worried at this time and I want to reassure you that King's takes the welfare of it's students very seriously.

We do have to explain though that we are unable to disclose any personal data about a student without their expressed written consent. We take confidentiality and data protection extremely seriously and we must be careful what information we release. We realise this isn't helpful but please do continue trying to reach them in the meantime. If you feel it is an emergency, please contact the emergency services on 999.

In this instance, we will forward your message to our Welfare Manager Nicky, who will get in contact with you as soon as possible to discuss this with you personally.

Warm regards,

The Residences Team

King's Residences
King's College London
kingsresidences@kcl.ac.uk
020 7848 5959
www.kcl.ac.uk/accommodation


Important: Do not change the subject line while replying.

";

Once you have logged in to SITS, please go directly to the PWD screen and change your password to something secure, that only you know. 

Data held within the SITS system is not to be accessed, disclosed, published or communicated in any way other than as provided for in the relevant university regulations, policies and procedures. Any data derived from the SITS system must be treated as confidential.

name: VodafoneManualRoam
content:
Thank you for the email.

A manual roam refreshes your connection to the network and can also resolve network issues, such as being unable to make/receive calls or send text messages/emails. To complete a manual roam, follow the steps below: 

From 'Apps', select 'Settings' 

Under 'Networks', select 'More' 

Select 'More'/'Mobile Networks'

Select 'Network'/'Network Operators'

Change Search mode to 'Manual' 

Change the Network Selection Mode from 'Automatic' to 'Manual', the phone will then scan for other available networks 

Select a different network, i.e. EE (you will see an error message to advise you will have 'emergency calls only') 

Please change Network Selection Mode back to Automatic, this will bring you back to Vodafone or your preferred network. 

If you do have any further issues after these steps, please let us know, and we will be happy to assist you further. 

Kind Regards

IT Service Desk
";

name: WindowsRemoteAccessIssue
content:
Hello,

Thank you for contacting the Service Desk. In order to help resolve your Windows Remote Access issue, could you please carry out the below steps:

1.  Open 'Manage user certificates' -> 'Personal' -> 'Certificates'

2.  Right click 'Certificates' -> 'All Tasks' -> 'Request New Certificate'

3.  Click 'Next' and 'Next' again

4.  Tick 'AOVPN User' and click 'Enroll'

5.  If 'KCL Windows Remote Access' does not change to 'Connected', push ticket to 'EUS Strand'


If this does not resolve the issue or you require assistance performing these steps, please call the IT Service Desk on 020 784 88888. ";
